ack.p: Dr Muhammed Elayadeth‚ÄêMeethal was the recipient of Rothamsted International Fellowship and worked within the Soil to Nutrition Institute Strategic Programme (BBS/E/C/000I0300). Kerala Veterinary and Animal Sciences University, University of Bristol, University of Western Australia, and Rothamsted Research are all members of the Global Farm Platform initiative https://www.globalfarmplatform.org/ that attracts researchers from different communities and disciplines seeking to develop sustainable ruminant production globally. The work was done as part of PhD of MEM. We thank Crawford Funding, Australia, for giving fellowship to MEM for training under SKM at University of Western Australia (UWA), Perth, Australia, on measurements in thermal physiology (project No. RA/3/100/1246). We also thank Kerala Veterinary and Animal Sciences University, Pookode, Wayanad, India; Vechur Conservation Trust, Thrissur, Kerala, India; National Institute of Animal Nutrition and Physiology, Bangalore, India; University of Western Australia, Perth, Australia; and Rothamsted Research, North Wyke, Devon, UK, for providing facilities for the study.
